Thoughts themselves don‚Äôt cause us angst, it‚Äôs the attachment to them that does.

Our shoulds often say yes even when yes is not best. 

Allowing our shoulds to control us makes us feel that we have no choice in our life leading us to feeling helpless and overwhelmed. 

Peace and Contentment can‚Äôt be found when we constantly allow our shoulds to be the boss.

Just because you get triggered by something doesn‚Äôt mean you aren‚Äôt progressing. 

Experiencing emotional relapses are normal.

It‚Äôs about working through how quickly you can acknowledge, accept, and move through the pain that tells us we are still moving forward.
A significant part of maintaining your peace is knowing what and who you‚Äôre allowing to have access to you.

Going to counseling not only significantly impacts you, but has a ripple effect on all of your relationships. 

It‚Äôs about developing the best version of yourself for you and others. 

We often miss how much this individual act positively impacts the whole system around us.
Don‚Äôt get so stuck in a hard moment that you miss all the good that‚Äôs manifesting around and within you!

If you‚Äôre going through a dark season, be intentional about finding ways to shine light into those places. 

It might not take the pain away, but it can help ease it. 

The light reminds you that hope is available and on the horizon even on your darkest day.

As we kick off #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth a few important reminders‚Ä¶
1. Physical and mental health are equally important 
2. We all struggle, there is no shame in seeking out help 
3. You are valuable & matter in this world 
4. Be a safe person someone can turn to if needed

If you want to adopt more of a Growth Mindset try‚Ä¶

1. Reframing failure as progress
2. Emphasizing your effort versus outcome 
3. Focusing on the process not product 
4. Staying committed to growth to be the best you can be vs. working hard to avoid failure
